revised_title: Development of Face Processing Skills in Children
tldr: The article discusses the development of face processing skills in children, from infancy to school age. It highlights the differences in how younger and older children encode, store, and make identity judgments of familiar faces. The study shows that face recognition abilities improve with age, and children learn to cope with facial transformations through experience. The article also explores the role of inspection time, facial distinctiveness, and background context in face processing.
